alert.note: Alert for Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Raleigh County through 145 PM EDT... At 118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flat Top, or near Camp Creek, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ghent. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
